title: How to Host a Web Server for Free on Your Computer

steps.title: Make sure your internet service contract allows hosting.
steps.content: Make sure your internet service contract allows hosting. Many internet service providers (ISPs) expressly forbid personal hosting unless you have a business plan, which often costs significantly more than a standard use plan. This shouldn't be an issue if your site only generates a few hits per month, but any kind of significant traffic will draw attention to your hosting. If your ISP prohibits home hosting, either upgrade your plan to one that allows hosting or switch to a different ISP before you continue. Failing to heed your ISP's policy for home hosting can result in anything from getting your internet turned off to having to pay fines.

steps.title: Ensure that your equipment can handle hosting.
steps.content: Ensure that your equipment can handle hosting. In order to host a website, you must have a computer on and connected to the Internet 24 hours per day, seven days per week. This is easier to accomplish with a secondary, older computer than it is with your primary computer. Restarting your computer to update will occasionally be necessary. During these updates, your website will be inaccessible.

steps.title: Update your computer.
steps.content: Update your computer. Ensure your computer is up-to-date with the latest operating system, security features, and drivers. Make sure you update Windows , macOS , or your Linux system before continuing. Also make sure you have a decent antivirus program , and firewall to protect your computer. You'll need to make sure port 80 is open behind your Firewall .

steps.title: Move your website's source code onto your computer.
steps.content: Move your website's source code onto your computer. This includes your HTML, CSS, and PHP files. You'll also need to move any media files, such as pictures and videos to your computer. If your website's source code isn't already in a file on your computer, copy it from your web service's settings into a text document on your computer and save it as a PHP or HTML file. If the website's source code is stored on your computer, make sure you know where to find it. If you haven't yet programmed your website , you'll need to do so before continuing. The main webpage for your website should be saved as "index.html" or "index.php."

steps.title: Download MAMP for Windows.
steps.content: Download MAMP for Windows. MAMP is a free website hosting application that works on both Windows and Mac machines. Use the following steps to download MAMP: Go to https://www.mamp.info/en/ . Click Free Download Click the MAMP & MAMP PRO button below the Windows icon. Wait for the installation file to finish downloading.

steps.title: Double-click the MAMP setup file.
steps.content: Double-click the MAMP setup file. It looks like a white elephant on a grey background. By default, your downloaded files can be found in your Downloads folder. [1] X Research source If prompted, click Yes on the Windows control access pop-up window.

steps.title: Complete the setup process.
steps.content: Complete the setup process. Use the following steps to do so: Click Next on the Welcome page. Uncheck the "MAMP PRO" box and click Next Check "I accept the agreement" and click Next Select an install location and click Next Select a Start menu location and Next . Check or uncheck "Create a desktop shortcut" and click Next . Review the installation and Start menu location and click Install .

steps.title: Copy your website's source code document.
steps.content: Copy your website's source code document. While MAMP is installing, find the document on your computer that you pasted the website's source code into earlier. To do so: Press Windows Key + E to open File Explorer. Open the Document's folder. Select the document by clicking it. Press Ctrl + C to copy it.

steps.title: Double-click the MAMP icon.
steps.content: Double-click the MAMP icon. It resembles a white elephant on a grey background. Make sure you aren't clicking the setup icon here. If you see a warning about port 80 appear; click Cancel on the warning window to dismiss it. If Windows Defender asks if you want to allow access to MAMP, click Allow Access .

steps.title: Click MAMP.
steps.content: Click MAMP . It's the first option in the menu bar at the top.

steps.title: Click Preferences….
steps.content: Click Preferences… . This gear-shaped icon is on the left side of the MAMP window. Doing so opens the Preferences window.

steps.title: Click the Ports tab.
steps.content: Click the Ports tab. It's at the top of the Preferences window. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click MAMP default.
steps.content: Click MAMP default . It's at the bottom of the page next to "Set Web and MySQL ports to:"

steps.title: Click the Server tab.
steps.content: Click the Server tab. It's at the top of the Preferences window.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . This button is near the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+V to paste your source code documents.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + V to paste your source code documents. The source code document will appear in the MAMP root folder. This is the location where you can store your website files.

steps.title: Click OK on the MAMP window.
steps.content: Click OK on the MAMP window. This will save your settings.

steps.title: Close and re-open MAMP.
steps.content: Close and re-open MAMP. To do so, click the MAMP button and then click Exit . Then double-click the MAMP icon to restart it.

steps.title: Click Start Servers if needed.
steps.content: Click Start Servers if needed. If MAMP's servers don't start automatically, click Start Servers . It's on the right side of the MAMP window. Doing so will start the MAMP server with your website's source code and port preferences. Your website should now be live; people will be able to access it by entering your public IP address into a search engine. You can also add a domain name to make your website easier to access. [3] X Research source Unless you pay for a static IP service, your local IP address—and, by extension, your website's address—will change from time to time. You cannot use your local IP address to view the website from your own network, since entering it will just take you to your router's page.

steps.title: Find out if your Mac has an Intel processor or an Apple Silicon processor.
steps.content: Find out if your Mac has an Intel processor or an Apple Silicon processor. In order to download the correct version of MAMP, you will need to know what type of processor your Mac has. You can find out what your Mac model is by clicking the Apple icon and clicking About this Mac . Most older Mac models have Intel processors. The following Mac models have Apple Silicon chips: [4] X Research source MacBook Pro (2021 or later). MacBook Pro (13-inch, M1, 2020 later). MacBook Air (2022 or later). MacBook Air (M1, 2020 or later). iMac (2021 or later). Mac mini (2020 or later). Mac Studio (2022 or later). Mac Pro (2023 or later).

steps.title: Download MAMP for macOS.
steps.content: Download MAMP for macOS. MAMP is a free website hosting application that works on both Windows and Mac machines. To download MAMP: Go to https://www.mamp.info/en/ . Click Free Download Click the MAMP & MAMP PRO (Intel) if you have an Intel processor. Click MAMP & MAMP PRO (Apple) if you have an Apple Silicon processor. Wait for the file to finish downloading.

steps.title: Double-click the MAMP setup file.
steps.content: Double-click the MAMP setup file. It is a ".pkg" file with an icon that resembles a brown box. If you receive a warning message that says the file can't be opened, verify the download before continuing.

steps.title: Complete the MAMP installation process.
steps.content: Complete the MAMP installation process. Use the following steps to do so: [5] X Research source Click Continue on the introduction page. Click Continue on the "Read Me" page. Click Continue on the License agreement page. Click Agree . Click Install . Enter your Mac's username and password, then click Install Software .

steps.title: Wait for MAMP to finish installing.
steps.content: Wait for MAMP to finish installing. This process will likely take around five minutes. Click Ok on any prompts the installer requests access to.

steps.title: Open Finder.
steps.content: Open Finder. It's the icon that resembles a blue and white smiley face. It's in the dock at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Go to your website's source code documents.
steps.content: Go to your website's source code documents. Click the folder in which the source code document that you copied or created earlier is located. You may have to click through several folders to get to the document, depending on where you saved it.

steps.title: Copy the documents.
steps.content: Copy the documents. Hold Shift and click the documents and folders to select them, then click Edit and click Copy .

steps.title: Open MAMP.
steps.content: Open MAMP. Click the MAMP icon, which resembles a white elephant on a grey background. You can find it in the Applications folder. If you can't find MAMP, click the magnifying glass icon in the upper-right corner and type "MAMP" in the search bar.

steps.title: Click Preferences….
steps.content: Click Preferences… . This gear-shaped icon is on the far-left side of the MAMP window. If you receive an error window, first click OK to exit the window.

steps.title: Click the Ports tab.
steps.content: Click the Ports tab. It's at the top of the Preferences window. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click the MAMP default button.
steps.content: Click the MAMP default button. You'll find this at the bottom of the page next to "Set Web and MySQL ports to:"

steps.title: Click the Server tab.
steps.content: Click the Server tab. It's the third tab at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click Open in Finder.
steps.content: Click Open in Finder . This will open the server location in Finder.

steps.title: Press ⌘ Command+V to paste your source code document.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Command + V to paste your source code document. This folder will be the location of your website and all of its files.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's at the bottom of the page. This saves your settings.

steps.title: Close and re-open MAMP.
steps.content: Close and re-open MAMP. To do so, click MAMP in the menu bar at the top and then click Quit MAMP .

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start . It's on the right side of the MAMP window. Doing so will start the MAMP server with your website's source code and port preferences. Your website should now be live; people will be able to access it by entering your public IP address into a search engine. You can also add a domain name to make your website easier to access. [7] X Research source Unless you pay for a dynamic IP service, your local IP address—and, by extension, your website's address—will change from time to time. You cannot use your local IP address to view the website from your own network, since entering it will just take you to your router's page.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+Alt+T to open the Terminal.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + Alt + T to open the Terminal. You can install LAMP on Linux using the Terminal. The Terminal has an icon that resembles a black screen with a white cursor. You can click the Terminal icon in the Apps menu, or use the keyboard shortcut to open the Terminal. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Update the software repository.
steps.content: Update the software repository. Before you begin, make sure the software repository is up-to-date. To do so, enter the following command and press Enter . sudo apt update .

steps.title: Install Apache.
steps.content: Install Apache. Apache is the HTTP server software you will be using. To install Apache, enter the following command and press Enter : sudo apt install apache2 -y

steps.title: Check if Apache is installed correctly.
steps.content: Check if Apache is installed correctly. The Apache server status should start running automatically. When you check the server status, it should return the output "Active: (running)" next to "Active." Enter the following command and press Enter to check the server status: sudo service apache2 status Press Ctrl + C to exit the service status screen.

steps.title: Check to make sure the UFW firewall has the Apache profiles.
steps.content: Check to make sure the UFW firewall has the Apache profiles. When you check the UFW firewall, it should return "Apache Full" as the output. Enter the following command and press Enter to check the Apache profile: sudo ufw app list

steps.title: Check that the Apache Full profile allows traffic on Ports 80 and 443.
steps.content: Check that the Apache Full profile allows traffic on Ports 80 and 443. When you enter the following command, it should return "80, 443/tcp" below "Ports." Enter the following command and press Enter . sudo ufw app info "Apache Full"

steps.title: Go to localhost in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to localhost in a web browser. All you need to do is open a web browser and type "localhost" in the address bar. This should display the Apache Ubuntu default page with the message "It works."

steps.title: Install MySQL.
steps.content: Install MySQL. MySQL is a relational database system. Enter the following command and press Enter to install MySQL: sudo apt install mysql-server -y

steps.title: Install PHP.
steps.content: Install PHP. PHP is a server-side scripting language that integrates well with MySQL. PHP is usually the final layer of LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, and PHP). Enter the following command and press Enter to install PHP: sudo apt install php libapache2-mod-php php-mysql -y

steps.title: Modify the Apache server files.
steps.content: Modify the Apache server files. By default, Apache looks for an "Index.html" index file. Modify the "dir.conf" file so that Apache looks for the "Index.php" file instead. Use the following steps to do so: Type sudo nano /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/dir.conf and press Enter . Delete "index.php" in the line after "DirectoryIndex." Re-enter "index.php" first after "DirectoryIndex" and before "index.html." Press Ctrl + X . Press y .

steps.title: Install additional PHP modules (optional).
steps.content: Install additional PHP modules (optional). If you want to install additional PHP modules, type apt-cache search php- and press Enter to see a list of all available modules along with a short description of each. Use the arrow keys to navigate the list. Type the name of a module and press Enter to see a full description. To install a module, type sudo apt install [module name] and press Enter . [9] X Research source

steps.title: Copy your website source code file.
steps.content: Copy your website source code file. To do so, open the Files app and navigate to where you have the source code files for your website saved. Right-click the documents and folders and click Copy .

steps.title: Navigate to the Apache Index folder.
steps.content: Navigate to the Apache Index folder. Use the following steps to do so: Open the Files app. Click Other locations in the menu bar to the left. Click Computer . Click var . Click www . Click html .

steps.title: Paste your web page source code files.
steps.content: Paste your web page source code files. To do so, right-click and click Paste . This pastes your website files into the Apache server folder. This is the folder where you can save your website pages and files. Your website should now be live; people will be able to access it by entering your public IP address into a search engine. You can also add a domain name to make your website easier to access.

steps.title: Register a domain name.
steps.content: Register a domain name. If you want people to access your local website using a domain name instead of your public IP address, you will first need to register a domain name . You can do so using services like GoDaddy.com , Namecheap.com , Domain.com , HostGator.com , Bluehost.com , Sauarespace.com , and more. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Log in to your domain registrar website.
steps.content: Log in to your domain registrar website. Go to the website you used to purchase your domain name. Log in with the username and password associated with your account.

steps.title: Select the option to manage domains.
steps.content: Select the option to manage domains. Your domain registrar should have an option that allows you to manage your domain names. Click this option.

steps.title: Click the DNS section for your domain name.
steps.content: Click the DNS section for your domain name. This will probably be a button that says DNS , DNS settings , or similar below your domain name. Click the option to modify the DNS settings for your domain name.

steps.title: Click the option to add a DNS record.
steps.content: Click the option to add a DNS record. This will be a button that says Add , Add Record , or something similar.

steps.title: Select an "A" type record.
steps.content: Select an "A" type record. This is the type of record that points a domain name to an IP address. If you are using an IPv6 address, select an "AAAA" type record instead.

steps.title: Type @ as the host.
steps.content: Type @ as the host. The "@" is a shorthand for the domain name. For example, if your domain name is "www.mywebsite.me", the "@" symbol is shorthand for the "mywebsite.me" portion of the domain name.

Add your public IP address to the record. This goes in the field that indicates what the host points to. Just enter the numeric portion of your IP address with the dots (.). You don't need to add "http://" or "https://" or anything like that.

steps.title: Add another record.
steps.content: Add another record. To do so, click the button to add a new record and select an "A" type record, or an "AAAA" type record for an IPv6 address.

steps.title: Type www as the host.
steps.content: Type www as the host. This will create a record for your full domain name. For example, if your domain name is "www.mywebsite.me", this will create a record for the entire domain name.

steps.title: Add your public IP address to the record.
steps.content: Add your public IP address to the record. This goes in the field that indicates what the host points to. Just enter the numeric portion of your IP address with the dots (.).

steps.title: Save the records.
steps.content: Save the records. To do so, click the button that says Save or Add Records or similar. This will save both records with your domain name pointing to your public IP address. Internet users can access your website by typing the domain name into their web browser. [11] X Research source Allow 24 hours for the domain records to be updated and to take effect.
